FuncDef:
The nat load-balance hash-arithmetic command configures a hash algorithm for ECMP and trunk load balancing on a CGN network.
The undo nat load-balance hash-arithmetic command restores the default configuration.
By default, the CRC64 algorithm corresponding to the 0x1EDC6F41 polynomial is used for ECMP and trunk load balancing on a CGN network.
CLIs: nat load-balance hash-arithmetic { hash-arithmetic1 | hash-arithmetic2 | hash-arithmetic3 }
undo nat load-balance hash-arithmetic { hash-arithmetic2 | hash-arithmetic3 }

ParaDef.Info:
Configures the CRC64 algorithm corresponding to the 0x1EDC6F41 polynomial.
-

Configures the CRC64 algorithm corresponding to the 0x04C11DB7 polynomial.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Load balancing routes calculated using a hash algorithm may vary according to network traffic models. If a hash algorithm does not meet your expectation, run the nat load-balance hash-arithmetic command to configure a hash algorithm. This command applies to ECMP and trunk load balancing on a CGN network.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E.
